intro: Oxylobium tetragonophyllum, commonly known as the four-angled oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Oxylobium tetragonophyllum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas.
